name: MedGlobal
mission:
MedGlobal is a humanitarian charitable non-governmental organization that provides emergency response and health programs to build resilience among vulnerable communities around the world. Our health programs support victims of wars and disasters, refugees, internally displaced persons, and marginalized communities in disaster-affected and low-resource settings.

MedGlobal was launched in 2017 by a diverse group of doctors, nurses, global health specialists, and humanitarians to address the health needs of the most vulnerable populations. MedGlobal partners with local communities to address their health priorities, builds resilience through training and education and deploys healthcare volunteers, and donates medical equipment, medications and supplies.

MedGlobal field teams support local health programs for vulnerable populations in North and Latin America, Africa, MENA region, Europe, and Southeast Asia. Our growing field teams and partner organizations are supported by selfless volunteer nurses, and medical professionals of all specialties from 27 countries who embrace our mission.
programs: Lebanon- Development and Relief Services & Emergency Response
Palestinian Territories - Development and Relief Services
Sudan- Development and Relief Services & Emergency Response
theoryOfChange: By partnering with local leaders and health professionals to deliver urgent care while investing in sustainable, community-owned solutions, MedGlobal builds stronger healthcare systems that endure beyond immediate crises.

all_citations.claim: MedGlobal has a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 85.9%.
The organization reported total revenue of $12,632,992 and operates programs in Bangladesh, Syria, and Pakistan.
MedGlobal is Zakat-eligible and maintains a specific policy regarding asnaf categories.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MedGlobal earns a 60/100 score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and high alignment with humanitarian causes, though its overall impact score is moderated by the direct provision nature of its work [2].
areas_for_improvement: Working capital reserves are limited to 3.4 months
Direct impact measurement data is currently limited compared to financial health scores

dimension_explanations.alignment: MedGlobal shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a Zakat-eligible organization that follows specific policies for the distribution of Zakat funds [4]. Its focus on global health and emergency response in regions like Syria and Pakistan addresses high-urgency humanitarian needs [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to direct service provision, reporting a total revenue of $12,632,992 used to fund medical operations in high-need areas [3]. While financial health is excellent, the impact score of 24/50 reflects a focus on direct provision where specific cost-per-beneficiary data is not yet fully utilized for ranking [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: MedGlobal, Inc. provides critical medical relief and health services to vulnerable populations in conflict zones and disaster-stricken regions.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.9%, ensuring the majority of funds reach those in need
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.13 per $1 raised
Verified Zakat-eligible status with a dedicated policy for asnaf categories
baseline_narrative.summary: MedGlobal, Inc. is a humanitarian organization that delivers essential healthcare services through its health posts in the Kutupalong refugee camp in Bangladesh, alongside relief programs in Syria and emergency response efforts in Pakistan [3]. The organization maintains a high level of financial transparency and accountability, earning a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100 [2].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize high-efficiency medical relief in Muslim-majority conflict zones and require verified zakat-eligible options.

Value high financial transparency and top-tier ratings
Prefer direct healthcare delivery over advocacy
Seek to support refugees in the Kutupalong camp and Syria
giving_considerations: High efficiency means almost all funds reach the field
Governance structure is currently undergoing maturation
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term academic research or those who prefer large, multi-decade legacy institutions with massive boards.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects <cite id="13">verified outcome tracking of 5 metrics</cite> and a documented theory of change, though full RCTs are not present.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MedGlobal works to eliminate barriers to health through <cite id="13">direct medical intervention and healthcare system strengthening</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions actually improve health outcomes in refugee settings.

strengths.detail: MedGlobal maintains a <cite id="2">98.98.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="5">low fundraising cost of $0.13 per $1 raised</cite>.
The organization focuses on <cite id="3">direct healthcare delivery</cite> in high-urgency zones like <cite id="10">Syria, Yemen, and Gaza</cite>.
MedGlobal has a <cite id="7">dedicated zakat policy</cite> serving specific asnaf categories including the <cite id="11">poor, needy, and wayfarers</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: MedGlobal's operational excellence is rooted in its ability to maintain <cite id="12">85.9% independent board members</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of its $12.6 million budget. Their <cite id="8">Platinum Seal from Candid</cite> is supported by the tracking of <cite id="13">five distinct outcome metrics</cite>, providing donors with more than just financial data. Furthermore, the organization demonstrates long-term sustainability with <cite id="9">3.4 months of operating reserves</cite>, significantly exceeding the 3-6 month industry benchmark for humanitarian groups.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2017, MedGlobal, Inc. is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">critical medical relief and health services</cite> to vulnerable populations in conflict zones and disaster-stricken regions. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="2">98.33/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. MedGlobal's primary mission involves <cite id="3">direct provision of healthcare</cite> through health posts in the Kutupalong refugee camp in Bangladesh, as well as relief programs in Syria, Yemen, and Gaza. In 2022, the organization reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $12,632,992</cite>, which was utilized to fund emergency relief, surgical skills labs, and healthcare system strengthening. Their operational model is characterized by <cite id="5">strong fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only $0.13 to raise every $1. By focusing on <cite id="6">underserved populations in Muslim-majority regions</cite>, MedGlobal bridges the gap in global health equity while maintaining <cite id="7">verified zakat-eligible status</cite> for Muslim donors. The organization holds a <cite id="8">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting its commitment to public disclosure and outcome tracking. Despite its relatively recent founding, MedGlobal has established itself as a <cite id="9">resilient institution with 3.4 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring stability in its mission to eliminate barriers to health in crisis areas.
